There should be a presumptive declassification of the documents surrounding the decision-making of this war. 

We need to ensure that the next time a president like Bush calls for a war of choice, we as a country can say no.

When the dust settles, we need to hold accountable the U.S. and Afghan national security officials who spent two decades dissembling and lying about the viability of the counterinsurgency effort in Afghanistan.

Since serving in Afghanistan, it was blindingly obvious that the American people have been constantly lied to about this war. 

President Biden had the integrity to tell Americans the truth.
We will hold the administration accountable for getting out American personnel, SIV qualifiers, allies, and refugees. This is our mission.

I fought alongside Afghan unit police ‚Äî they are good tacticians who care about their homeland. But their leadership is corrupt. 

The first rule of combat is that leadership holds the line, and there was no leadership from the Afghan central government.

The¬†Taliban takeover was sudden, but the bankruptcy of American foreign policy in Afghanistan was gradual. 

It‚Äôs been a 20-year failure, because what began as a counterterrorism mission devolved under Bush, Cheney, and Rumsfeld into a boondoggle of a counterinsurgency effort.

I spoke with @jim_newell of @Slate about what went wrong in Afghanistan, President Biden's integrity, and our current mission.

THREAD ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/pb35uAOKrU

For the first time since 9/11, the commander-in-chief just told the American people the truth about Afghanistan. Counterterrorism is a military mission; counterinsurgency is a political one. U.S. forces will fight terrorists, but Afghans must fight for Afghanistan.

President Biden has been clear that he‚Äôs not going to hand off a failed forever war to yet another administration.

We are not going to be in the business of nation building or counterinsurgency in Afghanistan anymore. https://t.co/hqcXj1HaOm
